decks.notes: The main concept of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using aggressive creatures like Fleecemane Lion and Siege Rhino, while also utilizing graveyard recursion with Den Protector and Deathmist Raptor. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with Thoughtseize and removal spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall, while also providing additional value with Satyr Wayfinder and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. The deck's mana base is designed to support its three-color combination, allowing for consistency in casting spells and maximizing efficiency in combat.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on a well-rounded aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Siege Rhino, Anafenza, and Fleecemane Lion to pressure the opponent's life total. The deck also includes powerful disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to establish control of the game and close out quickly with strong finishers like Wingmate Roc and Sorin.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on early creature aggression backed up by removal and disruption. The deck aims to play efficient threats like Anafenza, Siege Rhino, and Rakshasa Deathdealer to pressure the opponent while using cards like Thoughtseize and Dromoka's Command to disrupt their game plan. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Solemn Visitor provides additional reach and resilience. Overall, the deck seeks to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures and versatile spells.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay with a mix of control elements. By using efficient creatures like Siege Rhino and Fleecemane Lion, along with removal spells like Abzan Charm and Hero's Downfall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their strategy. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Nissa, Worldwaker and Elspeth, Sun's Champion provides additional threats and value. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with spells like Thoughtseize and Read the Bones to maintain momentum while controlling the board.

The main concept of this deck is to use ramp creatures like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to accelerate mana production, allowing for the quick summoning of big threats like Polukranos, World Eater and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. Control aspects are added with counterspells like Negate and Disdainful Stroke, as well as with removal options such as Whisperwood Elemental and Nissa, Worldwaker. The deck aims to control the board early on, ramp into powerful late-game threats, and overwhelm the opponent with large creatures and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures such as Dragonlord Ojutai and Silumgar, the Drifting Death. It utilizes cards like Silumgar's Scorn and Foul-Tongue Invocation to disrupt the opponent's strategy while digging for key cards with Dig Through Time. The deck also includes hand disruption with Thoughtseize and planeswalker support with Ashiok, Nightmare Weaver. The mana base provides the necessary colors to cast the powerful spells in the deck, allowing for strategic plays and outmaneuvering opponents.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering spells, removing threats, and ultimately winning with powerful dragon creatures like Dragonlord Ojutai and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The key strategy is to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent with efficient removal and counterspells. The deck includes a mix of creature removal, counter spells, and powerful dragons to close out the game. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Haven of the Spirit Dragon and Crucible of the Spirit Dragon to support the dragon theme and enable powerful late-game plays.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a quick and aggressive strategy using creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster, Foundry Street Denizen, and Monastery Swiftspear. The goal is to flood the board with tokens from cards like Dragon Fodder and Hordeling Outburst, while also burning the opponent with direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Stoke the Flames. Atarka's Command provides extra reach and utility, while Zurgo Bellstriker and Lightning Berserker offer additional early game pressure. The deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing low-cost creatures like Frenzied Goblin, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Monastery Swiftspear to deal damage quickly. Cards like Wild Slash, Lightning Strike, and Atarka's Command provide direct damage to control the board, while cards like Stoke the Flames and Become Immense offer additional finishers. Generating tokens with Dragon Fodder and Hordeling Outburst helps to build a wide board presence. With a low land count and efficient mana base, this deck looks to win the game quickly through aggressive tactics.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to play powerful threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Thunderbreak Regent early in the game. It also includes burn spells like Draconic Roar and Crater's Claws for removal and finishing off opponents. The addition of planeswalkers like Xenagos, the Reveler provides additional ramp and token generation, while Nissa, Worldwaker can animate lands for additional threats. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster, Thunderbreak Regent, and Stormbreath Dragon to quickly bring down the opponent's life total. It also includes disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Crackling Doom to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Soulfire Grand Master provide additional value. The deck utilizes a mix of removal, burn spells, and powerful dragons to establish board control and pressure the opponent into making unfavorable trades. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan and ensure consistent access to all colors of mana.

The key concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to establish a strong board presence early on with efficient creatures like Courser of Kruphix, Fleecemane Lion, and Den Protector, while using cards like Collected Company and Dromoka's Command to maintain control and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and combat tricks, while also utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Elvish Mystic to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and secure a victory in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Satyr Wayfinder and Sylvan Caryatid, while also benefiting from the graveyard with cards like Sidisi, Brood Tyrant and Den Protector. The deck also includes powerful dragons like Dragonlord Atarka and Silumgar, the Drifting Death to apply pressure on the opponent. Utilizing cards like Whip of Erebos and Tasigur, the Golden Fang, the deck aims to control the board and generate card advantage. Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall are included to disrupt the opponent's game plan and clear the way for aggressive creatures to finish off the opponent.
